Jose.src

Class JoseMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.newdawn.slick.BasicGame
      • Jose.src.JoseMain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.Game, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener

    public class JoseMain
extends org.newdawn.slick.BasicGame
    Main game class, updates and renders the game, selects levels. Game: (visualisation of the running process) Constructor Init Level Loop: Init Level Game Loop Update Render
    Author:
    Dzejrou

    • Field Detail

      • curr_state

        private JoseMain.STATE curr_state
        The game's current state.

      • map

        private org.newdawn.slick.tiled.TiledMap map
        Reference to the current level's map.

      • characters

        private java.util.List<Character> characters
        List containing all of the current level's characters.

      • view

        private View view
        Current level's view (camera).

      • player

        private Player player
        Reference to the player (outside of characters). Used to check if he's dead (to preserve the score in the ENDED state).

      • window_width

        private static int window_width
        Window dimensions.

      • window_height

        private static int window_height
        Window dimensions.

      • current_level

        public int current_level
        Current level number (for map choice). 0 = Test level, used for debug only and can be messed with. 1 = Starting standard grass level. 2 = Water platform level. 3 = Narrow rock tomb with lava.

      • levels_total

        public final int levels_total
        Total number of levels accessible, increment this number after creating a level. This is used to check if the player is not load an invalid level (negative or non existing positive level number).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • game_container

        private org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer game_container
        Reference to the game container. Used for misc stuff like getting input where there isn't container as parameter and making it a parameter wouldn't be that good.

      • player_score

        private int player_score
        Used to preserve last level's score, so that when the player dies, his score gets reset to this value.

      • debug_possible

        private final boolean debug_possible
        Indicates if the player can enter the debug mode. Set this to false in release version, false otherwise. Without this set, the "turn debug on" key (G) will be ignored and as a result of this, every other debug key will.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • portal

        private Portal portal
        Portal used to end the level.

      • level_change_cooldown

        private int level_change_cooldown
        Keeps track of the number of frames since the last level change, used for debug purposes - this prohibits one button click to change the level multiple times.

        Constructor, sets all necessary attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method of the game, creates an instance of the JoseMain object and runs it.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments.

      • init

        public void init(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer cont)
          throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Initializes the game object by calling init_level on the starting level. Called only after the game's constructor, things that need to be done between levels should be in init_level, not in init.
        Specified by:
        init in interface org.newdawn.slick.Game
        Specified by:
        init in class org.newdawn.slick.BasicGame
        Parameters:
        cont - The game container.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during level load.

      • update

        public void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer cont,
                   int i)
            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Updates the game on each frame.
        Specified by:
        update in interface org.newdawn.slick.Game
        Specified by:
        update in class org.newdawn.slick.BasicGame
        Parameters:
        cont - The game container.
        i - Time passed since the last update call.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during GameContainer manipulation.

      • render

        public void render(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer cont,
                   org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
            throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Renders all of the game's tiles, characters and objects. Also renders the LOST/WON text when the level/game has ended.
        Parameters:
        cont - The game container.
        g - The game's graphics context.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during graphis drawing.

      • render_running

        private void render_running(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Renders the game while in the running state. Draws portal, all characters and platforms and coins through the player.
        Parameters:
        g - The game's gics context.

      • init_level

        private void init_level(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer cont,
                        int level_number)
                 throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Initializes a given level by loading it's characters, map, view etc.
        Parameters:
        cont - The game container.
        level_number - The number of the level being initialized.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during level load.

      • get_coins_from_map

        java.util.List<Coin> get_coins_from_map(org.newdawn.slick.tiled.TiledMap m)
        Checks the current level map's tiles in the layer 0 for the locations, colors and values of all coins. Uses XML parsing from the class TiledMap. TODO: Merge the three map parsing functions into one, so that only one check is required per tile.
        Parameters:
        m - Reference to the current level's map.
        Returns:
        List of all coin object in the current level.

      • get_platforms_from_map

        private java.util.List<Platform> get_platforms_from_map(org.newdawn.slick.tiled.TiledMap m)
        Get's platforms from the 0 layer in the current level's map and returns them in a List. Uses XML parsing from the class TiledMap. TODO: Merge all map parsing functions into one, so that only one check per tile is required.
        Parameters:
        m - The target tile map.
        Returns:
        List of all movable platforms in the current level.

      • next_level

        public void next_level()
                throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Loads the next level of the game. Checks if the level number is ok - there is an actual map for it.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during level load.

      • prev_level

        public void prev_level()
                throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Loads the previous level of the game. Checks if the level number is ok - there is an actual map for it.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - When error occurs during the level load.
